title: Assessment Anchors and Eligible Content (2007): Grade 8
subject: Science (2009-2012)

7E8D2EE307974DEF9B36243B7BF31BB0.description: Compare and contrast characteristics of celestial bodies found in the solar system.

5711F2113D864033A257056D41D8AE70.description: Describe the role of gravity as the force that governs the movement of the solar system and universe.

7263DA852B8C4BAF8DCDB997B30763F2.description: Describe patterns of earth's movements in relation to the moon and sun.

9D98E3D7C67B43C987648DC223AFDDC5.description: Explain the relationships between and among the objects of our solar system.

43E4254D32E9499FB3B9474BC416E305.description: Identify how cloud types, wind directions, and barometric pressure changes are associated with weather patterns in different regions of the country.

19851EEEC219471688D855A26EBBCD5A.description: Identify how global patterns of atmospheric movement influence regional weather and climate.

A98AD589156A4349A6F3C9C84E7FCA00.description: Explain the impact of water systems on the local weather or the climate of a region.

6062934D06D7451CB5C37D100BFEA2B6.description: Explain how pressure, temperature, moisture, and wind are used to describe atmospheric conditions that affect regional weather or climate.

4AEDA09E8B2043C7B85BD4DF8BDB63A4.description: Identify the physical characteristics of a stream and how these characteristics determine the types of organisms found within the stream environment.

5E5E7B1B829D451C9B8BBD3AC2431853.description: Distinguish among different water systems and describe their relationships to each other as well as to landforms.

F704C351EEB94548AEB86A405E199B68.description: Compare and contrast characteristics of freshwater and saltwater systems on the basis of their physical characteristics and their use as natural resources.

8EE11DEE845F4BDB98080E155B9CA8CD.description: Describe the water cycle and the physical processes on which it depends.

D66FB131957249889EA25DD96693C649.description: Describe characteristic features of Earth's water systems or their impact on resources.

BAD1F818ED7848899F53441FEFD2013F.description: Describe potential impacts of human-made processes on Earth's resources, both nonliving and living.

48FFB3AACECA43818B77A4B002158B64.description: Describe a product's transformation process from production to consumption and explain the process's potential impact on Earthy's resources.

7FDAAA440D934A1591CCD994F3B44B6C.description: Describe the potential impact of human-made processes on changes to Earth's resources and how they affect everyday life.

C55156001F724EB3A80F3813C7CB2D44.description: Explain how fossils provide evidence about plants and animals that once lived throughout Pennsylvania's history.

D504D0B909094ABC8D6560F7FCA72A80.description: Identify soil types and their characteristics found in different biomes and in Pennsylvania, and explain how they formed.

AB1135D2746E46FFA1B15D8F0781140F.description: Describe natural processes that change Earth's surface.

DFFDDB3F877E401CAA623DD343F71F23.description: Explain the rock cycle as changes in the solid earth and rock types.

D5DD46FBFF27466D82924A98D243C0CA.description: Describe constructive and destructive natural processes that form different geologic structures and resources.

B5F5ED1352574E4C938DA954771438CA.description: Explain that mechanical advantage helps to do work by either changing a force or changing the direction of the applied force.

3133AE3088C6464181D8F0A122FCBBFC.description: Distinguish between kinetic and potential energy.

CC635320CB6A43B8B2673D2E6D4E95C4.description: Describe the effect of multiple forces on the movement, speed, or direction of an object.

6FB47F8A065540679239C7304976A01A.description: Describe the waste derived from the use of renewable and nonrenewable resources and their potential impact on the environment.

79D1E4D09D9F4C0A8B4F2682F4E6EA64.description: Compare the time span of renewability for fossil fuels and the time span of renewability for alternative fuels.

270E79FE15164D539C8029B0D31D31CE.description: Describe the Sun as the major source of energy that impacts the environment.

6E56EB06490845BB9CAD0E2EC9946243.description: Compare the environmental impact of different energy sources chosen to support human endeavors.

CFD324BE2E064A95BB53AEF4294D8CAD.description: Describe how one form of energy can be converted into a different form of energy.

72932886DB9F4A9D816AF7CCBB84B50A.description: Explain how energy is transferred from one place to another through convection, conduction, or radiation.

BDEC3EC472EB412A89957E2CDCF9122E.description: Distinguish among forms of energy and sources of energy.

B5276DDDA3524CC5871F8DB321DFCFF5.description: Describe energy sources, transfer of energy, or conversion of energy.

CD2D429E7C0D44BFB163C22C2350E00A.description: Identify and describe reactants and products of simple chemical reactions.

41DD7E28EEAC4DC5AB41B718609AEE1A.description: Use characteristic physical or chemical properties to distinguish one substance from another.

A618629B0D4F434FB9901E71AF98C6A9.description: Explain the differences among elements, compounds, and mixtures.

F320FCBA8E4E410F80FD31F46878DC4C.description: Explain concepts about the structure and properties of matter.

8BFD0EE468334A308324BDF2AAFC57ED.description: Explain the long-term effects of using integrated pest management on the environment.

12D21992317F49BE83231CE3F8BB18A6.description: Describe how waste management affects the environment.

EC47C4D2573F437683273C468B3D99E6.description: Explain how renewable and nonrenewable resources provide for human needs.

3CC1CF8162864E2EA1332A355202A4FF.description: Explain how human activities may affect local, regional, and global environments.

8BC571E1CAA54F08A879778C55A6824F.description: Explain how renewable and non-renewable resources provide for human needs or how these needs impact the environment.

A1B7A4F74DA54009827784265717E88B.description: Describe the response of organisms to environmental changes and how those changes affect survival.

C48D1F00E466493096E70597ECB5C373.description: Use evidence to explain how diversity affects the ecological integrity of natural systems.

3ABD29D488D143A39C872393CA0AC2E0.description: Use evidence to explain factors that affect changes in populations.

5E74E1E59A40460080EA40A37E28E05A.description: Identify evidence of change to infer and explain the ways different variables may affect change in natural or human-made systems.

B402E65CD7AB4CADBADA18F8F88A4775.description: Explain relationships among organisms in an ecosystem.

9C5FEA249D6C46FAB2E317848345282C.description: Identify major biomes and describe abiotic and biotic components.

6A05630546DB4636A1E73C5C45306417.description: Explain the flow of energy through an ecosystem.

A7EC3AFD21C84088BF85EF56653698C9.description: Explain the relationships among and between organisms in different ecosystems and their abiotic and biotic components.

1A096A140EB8413D831C4A6674660C45.description: Recognize that the gene is the basic unit of inheritance, that there are dominant and recessive genes, and that traits are inherited.

AB0946E999194519983BC298345E6E3B.description: Identify and explain differences between inherited and acquired traits.

B9D935D5D2794F3BA3D9BABF14D74510.description: Explain how a set of genetic instructions determines inherited traits of organisms.

75D0DE5B32EF450C8A94B0789357D88E.description: Explain that adaptations are developed over long periods of time and are passed from one generation to another.

A941EFFDDA5C4D15BB81C66D795A163E.description: Describe how selective breeding or biotechnology can change the genetic makeup of organisms.

C73D66B5F7D94CC18AE5721903719CF5.description: Explain that mutations can alter a gene and are the original source of new variations.

DF9A3CD3643C4D339EDB7D57F90C9330.description: Explain how different adaptations in individuals of the same species may affect survivability or reproduction success.

BFDE2F10227D4C3BB629E66B01E98BC1.description: Explain how inherited structures or behaviors help organisms survive and reproduce in different environments.

C5D1B1820D0743548BD6EF03CD159114.description: Explain the basic concepts of natural selection.

14103BA879D045AF91543AB1005DAF3E.description: Identify the levels of organization from cell to organism and describe how specific structures, which underlie larger systems, enable the system to function as a whole.

565C1749D26F4524A560F8A5576775D0.description: Apply knowledge of characteristic structures to identify or categorize organisms.

8EF90F3D392F4562B1F332990AFB58D2.description: Compare similarities and differences in internal structures of organisms and external structures.

9FB7F00151BA40949212A8C7BE2C0B06.description: Describe the structures of living things that help them function effectively in specific ways.

95E9184DCE1444A08617D49F1FB30491.description: Describe and compare structural and functional similarities and differences that characterize diverse living things.

EA942B3A95EC4223BF66302B28F1A4B6.description: Describe repeating structure patterns in nature or periodic patterns.

3256FAA901DE4695B2D334EC57415217.description: Identify and describe patterns as repeated processes or recurring elements in human-made systems.

06C8655E965247A5BC2F299C31102242.description: Describe repeated processes or recurring elements in natural, scientific, and technological patterns.

68733D756F8B404BBBC56CF910759935.description: Given a model showing simple cause-and-effect relationships in a natural system, predict results that can be used to test the assumptions in the model.

E29E0F2A4BE8497FA44B8A7773423FD4.description: Describe how engineers use models to develop new and improved technologies to solve problems.

6E975F3F9E494BB3AE4E36AAEF9CD7C0.description: Describe how scientists use models to explore relationships in natural systems.

5C423A325C3647879CE2071A4D59691D.description: Apply knowledge of models to make predictions, draw inferences, or explain technological concepts.

80A1562E6E8944138F255947E5DA5BA3.description: Explain how components of natural and human-made systems play different roles in a working system.

CD92037D9338486CB0E6D12859A4F30F.description: Distinguish between open loop and closed loop systems.

A8F710AA807B419F9C4DA3D9F498D45F.description: Distinguish among system inputs, system processes, system outputs, and feedback.

361045C232424DBCBAE72D14424759D9.description: Explain the concept of order in a system.

501480F0EFAE4366BFE67024FE01240A.description: Describe a system as a group of related parts with specific roles that work together to achieve an observed result.

87E1C39B4B2D417FB7C04B7191D28CE9.description: Explain the parts of a simple system, their roles, and their relationships to the system a a whole.

8D03D10A9173457990FEE011853C6306.description: Describe ways technology extends and enhances human abilities for specific purposes.

5F4CA9F8634E491DA601F40F72282804.description: Apply appropriate measurement systems to record and interpret observations under varying conditions.

1DC56CE12CE04927B6922DA4F2419091.description: Describe the appropriate use of instruments and scales to accurately and safely measure time, mass, distance, volume, or temperature under a variety of conditions.

5D3AC7F729C64959BDF04B2A84AA6C13.description: Apply appropriate instruments for a specific purpose and describe the information the instrument can provide.

23FE01DCE8F64EFFBB5BC91C62606800.description: Identify a design flaw in a simple technological system and devise possible working solutions.

C9720DA8EEAE4947935CB894836FA092.description: Use evidence from investigations to clearly communicate and support conclusions.

980D51B6686B4349A88E8971A384E6F3.description: Interpret data/observations; develop relationships among variables based on data/observations to design models as solutions.

74AE8351F4FE4E46B0AA0C2E9A4A04C0.description: Design a controlled experiment by specifying how the independent variables will be manipulated, how the dependent variable will be measured, and which variables will be held constant.

D7984A83B7D142CEBFB4B55A867224E3.description: Use space/time relationships, define concepts operationally, raise testable questions, or formulate hypotheses.

E4B5F4D43AA046BEB0BCB582120F8746.description: Use evidence, observations, or a variety of scales to describe relationships.

ABB9C99BA5A5494B8B6C0F881A1AC661.description: Apply knowledge of scientific investigation or technological design in different contexts to make inferences to solve problems.

3CCB5CD31E5E432BB471DF85E424F916.description: Given a scenario, explain how a dynamically changing environment provides for the sustainability of living systems.

569788088EAD45229C0000A82907030B.description: Examine systems changing over time, identifying the possible variables causing this change, and drawing inferences about how these variables affect this change.

5BC943B404D14F789CEF96D3F6056884.description: Use evidence, observations, or explanations to make inferences about change in systems over time and the variables affecting these changes.

669587A1F8894C22BC5FAB421185C68D.description: Identify and analyze evidence that certain variables may have caused measurable changes in natural or human-made systems.

BA8A6EA990874B8382FAE76539E81742.description: Explain society's standard of living in terms of technological advancements and how these advancements impact on agriculture.

A73F035CA55F44ACB254CC94BD8B5D8C.description: Describe fundamental scientific or technological concepts that could solve practical problems.

B909D21708E44DFDB887614D1814C57B.description: Identify environmental issues and explain their potential long-term health effects.

B4162E63346C4C838EDFC7CBF810737F.description: Describe the positive and negative, intended and unintended, effects of specific scientific results or technological developments

8257CF33AE154BE5B3B3A5288F82C9C6.description: Identify and explain the impacts of applying scientific, environmental, or technological knowledge to address solutions to practical problems.

9D9B0B96CF154B8B8BDF8FBF1B51B42E.description: Develop descriptions, explanations, predictions, and models using evidence.

53BD84948F934C43A0D31FDFA86AC550.description: Use evidence, such as observations or experimental results, to support inferences about a relationship.

EADF708D38804496851FDB21932C5989.description: Explain how certain questions can be answered through scientific inquiry and/or technological design.

ACB91DA5E72642C1A13E729EECB5CA4A.description: Distinguish between a scientific theory and an opinion, explaining how a theory is supported with evidence, or how new data/information may change existing theories and practices.

E6DE8F98708A47D1BD3E52C7A87F97E6.description: Explain, interpret, and apply scientific, environmental, or technological knowledge presented in a variety of formats (e.g., visuals, scenarios, graphs).
